The humor and satire in this image come from the juxtaposition of the two scenes labeled "YES," and "BUT."

On the left side, labeled "YES," we have a scene where a large umbrella perfectly covers people who are sitting in an orderly circle, creating a harmonious and practical setup.

On the right side, labeled "BUT," the umbrella, although the same size, fails to provide practical coverage because of the random positioning of the tables and chairs, which don’t align with the umbrella's protective area.

The caption and the visuals together create a humorous commentary on how simply having the right tools or resources (like the umbrella) isn't enough if they aren't used effectively or thoughtfully. It satirizes the often inefficient or illogical application of solutions in real-life situations.
